crate9/mfe_mucap.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         mfe.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     The system part of the MIDAS frontend. Has to be
00007                 linked with user code to form a complete frontend
00008 
00009   ** muCap patches **
00010   - added frontend_early_init() to allow the frontend to modify its name
00011     and equipment structure. 
00012   - added extra transition function pre_begin_of_run().
00013   - turned off buffer caching, which doesn't make sense for our large
00014     event sizes and which seemed to lead to instability.
00015   - turned on "event channel."
00016

00377 #ifdef PART_OF_MUCAP

00379 
00380 INT tr_prestart(INT rn, char *error)
00381 {

00383   status = pre_begin_of_run(rn, error);
00384   return status;
00385 }
00386 #endif
00387 
00388 INT tr_start(INT rn, char *error)
00389 {
00390    INT i, status;
00391 
00392    /* reset serial numbers */
00393    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
00394       equipment[i].serial_number = 1;
00395       equipment[i].subevent_number = 0;
00396       equipment[i].stats.events_sent = 0;
00397       equipment[i].odb_in = equipment[i].odb_out = 0;
00398    }
00399 
00400    status = begin_of_run(rn, error);
00401 
00402    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
00403       run_state = STATE_RUNNING;
00404       run_number = rn;
00405 
00406       send_all_periodic_events(TR_START);
00407 
00408       if (display_period) {
00409          ss_printf(14, 2, "Running ");
00410          ss_printf(36, 2, "%d", rn);
00411       }
00412 
00413       /* enable interrupts */
00414       interrupt_enable(TRUE);
00415    }
00416 
00417    return status;
00418 }
00419 
00420 /*-- prestop -------------------------------------------------------*/
00421 
00422 INT tr_stop(INT rn, char *error)
00423 {
00424    INT status, i;
00425    EQUIPMENT *eq;
00426 
00427    /* disable interrupts */
00428    interrupt_enable(FALSE);
00429 
00430    status = end_of_run(rn, error);
00431 
00432    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
00433       /* don't send events if already stopped */
00434       if (run_state != STATE_STOPPED)
00435          send_all_periodic_events(TR_STOP);
00436 
00437       run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00438       run_number = rn;
00439 
00440       if (display_period)
00441          ss_printf(14, 2, "Stopped ");
00442    } else
00443       interrupt_enable(TRUE);
00444 
00445    /* flush remaining buffered events */
00446    rpc_flush_event();
00447    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
00448       if (equipment[i].buffer_handle) {
00449          INT err = bm_flush_cache(equipment[i].buffer_handle, SYNC);
00450          if (err != BM_SUCCESS) {
00451             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestop", "bm_flush_cache(SYNC) error %d", err);
00452             return err;
00453          }
00454       }
00455 
00456    /* update final statistics record in ODB */
00457    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
00458       eq = &equipment[i];
00459       eq->stats.events_sent += eq->events_sent;
00460       eq->bytes_sent = 0;
00461       eq->events_sent = 0;
00462    }
00463 
00464    db_send_changed_records();
00465 
00466    return status;
00467 }
00468 
00469 /*-- pause ---------------------------------------------------------*/
00470 
00471 INT tr_pause(INT rn, char *error)
00472 {
00473    INT status;
00474 
00475    /* disable interrupts */
00476    interrupt_enable(FALSE);
00477 
00478    status = pause_run(rn, error);
00479 
00480    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
00481       run_state = STATE_PAUSED;
00482       run_number = rn;
00483 
00484       send_all_periodic_events(TR_PAUSE);
00485 
00486       if (display_period)
00487          ss_printf(14, 2, "Paused  ");
00488    } else
00489       interrupt_enable(TRUE);
00490 
00491    return status;
00492 }
00493 
00494 /*-- resume --------------------------------------------------------*/
00495 
00496 INT tr_resume(INT rn, char *error)
00497 {
00498    INT status;
00499 
00500    status = resume_run(rn, error);
00501 
00502    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
00503       run_state = STATE_RUNNING;
00504       run_number = rn;
00505 
00506       send_all_periodic_events(TR_RESUME);
00507 
00508       if (display_period)
00509          ss_printf(14, 2, "Running ");
00510 
00511       /* enable interrupts */
00512       interrupt_enable(TRUE);
00513    }
00514 
00515    return status;
00516 }

00518 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00520 INT manual_trigger(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
00521 {
00522    manual_trigger_event_id = CWORD(0);
00523    return SUCCESS;
00524 }

00526 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00527 
00528 INT register_equipment(void)
00529 {
00530    INT index, count, size, status, i, j, k, n;
00531    char str[256];
00532    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00533    EQUIPMENT_STATS *eq_stats;
00534    DWORD start_time, delta_time;
00535    HNDLE hKey;
00536    BOOL manual_trig_flag = FALSE;
00537    BANK_LIST *bank_list;
00538    DWORD dummy;
00539 
00540    /* get current ODB run state */
00541    size = sizeof(run_state);
00542    run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00543    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/State", &run_state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00544    size = sizeof(run_number);
00545    run_number = 1;
00546    status =
00547        db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00548    assert(status == SUCCESS);
00549 
00550    /* scan EQUIPMENT table from FRONTEND.C */
00551    for (index = 0; equipment[index].name[0]; index++) {
00552       eq_info = &equipment[index].info;
00553       eq_stats = &equipment[index].stats;
00554 
00555       if (eq_info->event_id == 0) {
00556          printf("\nEvent ID 0 for %s not allowed\n", equipment[index].name);
00557          cm_disconnect_experiment();
00558          ss_sleep(5000);
00559          exit(0);
00560       }
00561 
00562       /* init status */
00563       equipment[index].status = FE_SUCCESS;
00564 
00565       /* check for event builder event */
00566       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_EB) {
00567 
00568          if (frontend_index == -1) {
00569             printf("\nEquipment \"%s\" has EQ_EB set, but no", equipment[index].name); 
00570             printf(" index specified via \"-i\" flag.\nExiting.");
00571             cm_disconnect_experiment();
00572             ss_sleep(5000);
00573             exit(0);
00574          }
00575 
00576          /* modify equipment name to <name>xx where xx is the frontend index*/
00577          sprintf(equipment[index].name+strlen(equipment[index].name), "%02d", frontend_index);
00578 
00579          /* modify event buffer name to <name>xx where xx is the frontend index*/
00580          sprintf(eq_info->buffer+strlen(eq_info->buffer), "%02d", frontend_index);
00581       }
00582 
00583       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Common", equipment[index].name);
00584 
00585       /* get last event limit from ODB */
00586       if (eq_info->eq_type != EQ_SLOW) {
00587          db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00588          size = sizeof(double);
00589          if (hKey)
00590             db_get_value(hDB, hKey, "Event limit", &eq_info->event_limit, &size,
00591                          TID_DOUBLE, TRUE);
00592       }
00593 
00594       /* Create common subtree */
00595       status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_COMMON_STR, TRUE);
00596       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00597          printf("Cannot check equipment record, status = %d\n", status);
00598          ss_sleep(3000);
00599       }
00600       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00601 
00602       if (equal_ustring(eq_info->format, "YBOS"))
00603          equipment[index].format = FORMAT_YBOS;
00604       else if (equal_ustring(eq_info->format, "FIXED"))
00605          equipment[index].format = FORMAT_FIXED;
00606       else                      /* default format is MIDAS */
00607          equipment[index].format = FORMAT_MIDAS;
00608 
00609       gethostname(eq_info->frontend_host, sizeof(eq_info->frontend_host));
00610       strcpy(eq_info->frontend_name, full_frontend_name);
00611       strcpy(eq_info->frontend_file_name, frontend_file_name);
00612 
00613       /* set record from equipment[] table in frontend.c */
00614       db_set_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO), 0);
00615 
00616       /* open hot link to equipment info */
00617       db_open_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO), MODE_READ, NULL, NULL);
00618 
00619     /*---- Create variables record ---------------------------------*/
00620       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables", equipment[index].name);
00621       if (equipment[index].event_descrip) {
00622          if (equipment[index].format == FORMAT_FIXED)
00623             db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, (char *) equipment[index].event_descrip, TRUE);
00624          else {
00625             /* create bank descriptions */
00626             bank_list = (BANK_LIST *) equipment[index].event_descrip;
00627 
00628             for (; bank_list->name[0]; bank_list++) {
00629                /* mabye needed later...
00630                   if (bank_list->output_flag == 0)
00631                   continue;
00632                 */
00633 
00634                if (bank_list->type == TID_STRUCT) {
00635                   sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables/%s", equipment[index].name,
00636                           bank_list->name);
00637                   status =
00638                       db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(bank_list->init_str), TRUE);
00639                   if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00640                      printf("Cannot check/create record \"%s\", status = %d\n", str,
00641                             status);
00642                      ss_sleep(3000);
00643                   }
00644                } else {
00645                   sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables/%s", equipment[index].name,
00646                           bank_list->name);
00647                   dummy = 0;
00648                   db_set_value(hDB, 0, str, &dummy, rpc_tid_size(bank_list->type), 1,
00649                                bank_list->type);
00650                }
00651             }
00652          }
00653       } else
00654          db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
00655 
00656       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables", equipment[index].name);
00657       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00658       equipment[index].hkey_variables = hKey;
00659 
00660       /*---- Create and initialize statistics tree -------------------*/
00661       
00662       sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Statistics", equipment[index].name);
00663 
00664       status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_STATISTICS_STR, TRUE);
00665       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00666          printf("Cannot create/check statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00667          ss_sleep(3000);
00668       }
00669 
00670       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00671       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00672          printf("Cannot find statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00673          ss_sleep(3000);
00674       }
00675 
00676       eq_stats->events_sent = 0;
00677       eq_stats->events_per_sec = 0;
00678       eq_stats->kbytes_per_sec = 0;
00679 
00680       /* open hot link to statistics tree */
00681       status =
00682           db_open_record(hDB, hKey, eq_stats, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_STATS), MODE_WRITE, NULL,
00683                          NULL);
00684       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00685          cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment", 
00686              "Cannot open statistics record, error %d. Probably other FE is using it",
00687               status);
00688          ss_sleep(3000);
00689       }
00690 
00691       /*---- open event buffer ---------------------------------------*/
00692 
00693       if (eq_info->buffer[0]) {
00694          status =
00695              bm_open_buffer(eq_info->buffer, EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE,
00696                             &equipment[index].buffer_handle);
00697          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
00698             cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment",
00699                    "Cannot open event buffer. Try to reduce EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE in midas.h \
00700 and rebuild the system.");
00701             return 0;
00702          }
00703 
00704          /* set the default buffer cache size */
00705          bm_set_cache_size(equipment[index].buffer_handle, 0, SERVER_CACHE_SIZE);
00706       } else
00707          equipment[index].buffer_handle = 0;
00708 
00709     /*---- evaluate polling count ----------------------------------*/
00710       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_POLLED) {
00711          if (display_period)
00712             printf("\nCalibrating");
00713 
00714          count = 1;
00715          do {
00716             if (display_period)
00717                printf(".");
00718 
00719             start_time = ss_millitime();
00720 
00721             poll_event(equipment[index].info.source, count, TRUE);
00722 
00723             delta_time = ss_millitime() - start_time;
00724 
00725             if (delta_time > 0)
00726                count = (INT) ((double) count * 100 / delta_time);
00727             else
00728                count *= 100;
00729          } while (delta_time > 120 || delta_time < 80);
00730 
00731          equipment[index].poll_count = (INT) ((double) eq_info->period / 100 * count);
00732 
00733          if (display_period)
00734             printf("OK\n");
00735       }
00736 
00737     /*---- initialize interrupt events -----------------------------*/
00738       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_INTERRUPT) {
00739          /* install interrupt for interrupt events */
00740 
00741          for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
00742             if (equipment[i].info.eq_type & EQ_POLLED) {
00743                equipment[index].status = FE_ERR_DISABLED;
00744                cm_msg(MINFO, "register_equipment",
00745                       "Interrupt readout cannot be combined with polled readout");
00746             }
00747 
00748          if (equipment[index].status != FE_ERR_DISABLED) {
00749             if (eq_info->enabled) {
00750                if (interrupt_eq) {
00751                   equipment[index].status = FE_ERR_DISABLED;
00752                   cm_msg(MINFO, "register_equipment",
00753                          "Defined more than one equipment with interrupt readout");
00754                } else {
00755                   interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH, eq_info->source,
00756                                       (PTYPE) interrupt_routine);
00757                   interrupt_eq = &equipment[index];
00758                   interrupt_odb_buffer = malloc(MAX_EVENT_SIZE + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
00759                }
00760             } else {
00761                equipment[index].status = FE_ERR_DISABLED;
00762                cm_msg(MINFO, "register_equipment",
00763                       "Equipment %s disabled in file \"frontend.c\"",
00764                       equipment[index].name);
00765             }
00766          }
00767       }
00768 
00769     /*---- initialize slow control equipment -----------------------*/
00770       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_SLOW) {
00771          /* resolve duplicate device names */
00772          for (i = 0; equipment[index].driver[i].name[0]; i++)
00773             for (j = i + 1; equipment[index].driver[j].name[0]; j++)
00774                if (equal_ustring(equipment[index].driver[i].name,
00775                                  equipment[index].driver[j].name)) {
00776                   strcpy(str, equipment[index].driver[i].name);
00777                   for (k = 0, n = 0; equipment[index].driver[k].name[0]; k++)
00778                      if (equal_ustring(str, equipment[index].driver[k].name))
00779                         sprintf(equipment[index].driver[k].name, "%s_%d", str, n++);
00780 
00781                   break;
00782                }
00783 
00784          /* loop over equipment list and call class driver's init method */
00785          if (eq_info->enabled)
00786             equipment[index].status = equipment[index].cd(CMD_INIT, &equipment[index]);
00787          else {
00788             equipment[index].status = FE_ERR_DISABLED;
00789             cm_msg(MINFO, "register_equipment",
00790                    "Equipment %s disabled in file \"frontend.c\"", equipment[index].name);
00791          }
00792 
00793          /* let user read error messages */
00794          if (equipment[index].status != FE_SUCCESS)
00795             ss_sleep(3000);
00796       }
00797 
00798       /*---- register callback for manual triggered events -----------*/
00799       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_MANUAL_TRIG) {
00800          if (!manual_trig_flag)
00801             cm_register_function(RPC_MANUAL_TRIG, manual_trigger);
00802 
00803          manual_trig_flag = TRUE;
00804       }
00805    }
00806 
00807    return SUCCESS;
00808 }
00809 
00810 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00811 
00812 void update_odb(EVENT_HEADER * pevent, HNDLE hKey, INT format)
00813 {
00814    INT size, i, ni4, tsize, status, n_data;
00815    void *pdata;
00816    char name[5];
00817    BANK_HEADER *pbh;
00818    BANK *pbk;
00819    BANK32 *pbk32;
00820    void *pydata;
00821    DWORD odb_type;
00822    DWORD *pyevt, bkname;
00823    WORD bktype;
00824    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyl;
00825    KEY key;
00826 
00827    /* outcommented sind db_find_key does not work in FTCP mode, SR 25.4.03
00828       rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP); */
00829 
00830    if (format == FORMAT_FIXED) {
00831       if (db_set_record(hDB, hKey, (char *) (pevent + 1),
00832                         pevent->data_size, 0) != DB_SUCCESS)
00833          cm_msg(MERROR, "update_odb", "event #%d size mismatch", pevent->event_id);
00834    } else if (format == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
00835       pbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (pevent + 1);
00836       pbk = NULL;
00837       pbk32 = NULL;
00838       do {
00839          /* scan all banks */
00840          if (bk_is32(pbh)) {
00841             size = bk_iterate32(pbh, &pbk32, &pdata);
00842             if (pbk32 == NULL)
00843                break;
00844             bkname = *((DWORD *) pbk32->name);
00845             bktype = (WORD) pbk32->type;
00846          } else {
00847             size = bk_iterate(pbh, &pbk, &pdata);
00848             if (pbk == NULL)
00849                break;
00850             bkname = *((DWORD *) pbk->name);
00851             bktype = (WORD) pbk->type;
00852          }
00853 
00854          n_data = size;
00855          if (rpc_tid_size(bktype & 0xFF))
00856             n_data /= rpc_tid_size(bktype & 0xFF);
00857 
00858          /* get bank key */
00859          *((DWORD *) name) = bkname;
00860          name[4] = 0;
00861 
00862          if (bktype == TID_STRUCT) {
00863             status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, name, &hKeyRoot);
00864             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00865                cm_msg(MERROR, "update_odb",
00866                       "please define bank %s in BANK_LIST in frontend.c", name);
00867                continue;
00868             }
00869 
00870             /* write structured bank */
00871             for (i = 0;; i++) {
00872                status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i, &hKeyl);
00873                if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
00874                   break;
00875 
00876                db_get_key(hDB, hKeyl, &key);
00877 
00878                /* adjust for alignment */
00879                if (key.type != TID_STRING && key.type != TID_LINK)
00880                   pdata =
00881                       (void *) VALIGN(pdata, MIN(ss_get_struct_align(), key.item_size));
00882 
00883                status = db_set_data(hDB, hKeyl, pdata, key.item_size * key.num_values,
00884                                     key.num_values, key.type);
00885                if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00886                   cm_msg(MERROR, "update_odb", "cannot write %s to ODB", name);
00887                   continue;
00888                }
00889 
00890                /* shift data pointer to next item */
00891                pdata = (char *) pdata + key.item_size * key.num_values;
00892             }
00893          } else {
00894             /* write variable length bank  */
00895             if (n_data > 0)
00896                db_set_value(hDB, hKey, name, pdata, size, n_data, bktype & 0xFF);
00897          }
00898 
00899       } while (1);
00900    } else if (format == FORMAT_YBOS) {
00901 #ifdef YBOS_SUPPORT
00902       YBOS_BANK_HEADER *pybkh;
00903 
00904       /* skip the lrl (4 bytes per event) */
00905       pyevt = (DWORD *) (pevent + 1);
00906       pybkh = NULL;
00907       do {
00908          /* scan all banks */
00909          ni4 = ybk_iterate(pyevt, &pybkh, &pydata);
00910          if (pybkh == NULL || ni4 == 0)
00911             break;
00912 
00913          /* find the corresponding odb type */
00914          tsize = odb_type = 0;
00915          for (i = 0; id_map[0].ybos_type > 0; i++) {
00916             if (pybkh->type == id_map[i].ybos_type) {
00917                odb_type = id_map[i].odb_type;
00918                tsize = id_map[i].tsize;
00919                break;
00920             }
00921          }
00922 
00923          /* extract bank name (key name) */
00924          *((DWORD *) name) = pybkh->name;
00925          name[4] = 0;
00926 
00927          /* reject EVID bank */
00928          if (strncmp(name, "EVID", 4) == 0)
00929             continue;
00930 
00931          /* correct YBS number of entries */
00932          if (pybkh->type == D8_BKTYPE)
00933             ni4 /= 2;
00934          if (pybkh->type == I2_BKTYPE)
00935             ni4 *= 2;
00936          if (pybkh->type == I1_BKTYPE || pybkh->type == A1_BKTYPE)
00937             ni4 *= 4;
00938 
00939          /* write bank to ODB, ni4 always in I*4 */
00940          size = ni4 * tsize;
00941          if ((status =
00942               db_set_value(hDB, hKey, name, pydata, size, ni4,
00943                            odb_type & 0xFF)) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00944             printf("status:%i odb_type:%li name:%s ni4:%i size:%i tsize:%i\n", status,
00945                    odb_type, name, ni4, size, tsize);
00946             for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
00947                float * fpydata = (float *) pydata;
00948                printf("data: %f\n", *(fpydata)++);
00949             }
00950          }
00951       } while (1);
00952 #endif                          /* YBOS_SUPPORT */
00953    }
00954 
00955    rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
00956 }
00957 
00958 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00959 
00960 int send_event(INT index)
00961 {
00962    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00963    EVENT_HEADER *pevent, *pfragment;
00964    char *pdata;
00965    unsigned char *pd;
00966    INT i, status;
00967    DWORD sent, size;
00968    static void *frag_buffer = NULL;
00969 
00970    eq_info = &equipment[index].info;
00971 
00972    /* check for fragmented event */
00973    if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_FRAGMENTED) {
00974       if (frag_buffer == NULL)
00975          frag_buffer = malloc(max_event_size_frag);
00976 
00977       if (frag_buffer == NULL) {
00978          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event",
00979                 "Not enough memory to allocate buffer for fragmented events");
00980          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00981       }
00982 
00983       pevent = frag_buffer;
00984    } else {
00985       /* return value should be valid pointer. if NULL BIG error ==> abort  */
00986       pevent = dm_pointer_get();
00987       if (pevent == NULL) {
00988          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "dm_pointer_get not returning valid pointer");
00989          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00990       }
00991    }
00992 
00993    /* compose MIDAS event header */
00994    pevent->event_id = eq_info->event_id;
00995    pevent->trigger_mask = eq_info->trigger_mask;
00996    pevent->data_size = 0;
00997    pevent->time_stamp = ss_time();
00998    pevent->serial_number = equipment[index].serial_number++;
00999 
01000    equipment[index].last_called = ss_millitime();
01001 
01002    /* call user readout routine */
01003    *((EQUIPMENT **) (pevent + 1)) = &equipment[index];
01004    pevent->data_size = equipment[index].readout((char *) (pevent + 1), 0);
01005 
01006    /* send event */
01007    if (pevent->data_size) {
01008       if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_FRAGMENTED) {
01009          /* fragment event */
01010          if (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) > (DWORD) max_event_size_frag) {
01011             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event",
01012                    "Event size %ld larger than maximum size %d for frag. ev.",
01013                    (long) (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)),
01014                    max_event_size_frag);
01015             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01016          }
01017 
01018          /* compose fragments */
01019          pfragment = dm_pointer_get();
01020          if (pfragment == NULL) {
01021             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "dm_pointer_get not returning valid pointer");
01022             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01023          }
01024 
01025          /* compose MIDAS event header */
01026          memcpy(pfragment, pevent, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01027          pfragment->event_id |= EVENTID_FRAG1;
01028 
01029          /* store total event size */
01030          pd = (char *) (pfragment + 1);
01031          size = pevent->data_size;
01032          for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
01033             pd[i] = (unsigned char) (size & 0xFF);      /* little endian, please! */
01034             size >>= 8;
01035          }
01036 
01037          pfragment->data_size = sizeof(DWORD);
01038 
01039          pdata = (char *) (pevent + 1);
01040 
01041          for (i = 0, sent = 0; sent < pevent->data_size; i++) {
01042             if (i > 0) {
01043                pfragment = dm_pointer_get();
01044 
01045                /* compose MIDAS event header */
01046                memcpy(pfragment, pevent, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01047                pfragment->event_id |= EVENTID_FRAG;
01048 
01049                /* copy portion of event */
01050                size = pevent->data_size - sent;
01051                if (size > max_event_size - sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
01052                   size = max_event_size - sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01053 
01054                memcpy(pfragment + 1, pdata, size);
01055                pfragment->data_size = size;
01056                sent += size;
01057                pdata += size;
01058             }
01059 
01060             /* send event to buffer */
01061             if (equipment[index].buffer_handle) {
01062 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01063                dm_pointer_increment(equipment[index].buffer_handle,
01064                                     pfragment->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01065 #else
01066                rpc_flush_event();
01067                status = bm_send_event(equipment[index].buffer_handle, pfragment,
01068                                       pfragment->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01069                if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01070                   cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "bm_send_event(SYNC) error %d", status);
01071                   return status;
01072                }
01073 #endif
01074             }
01075          }
01076 
01077          if (equipment[index].buffer_handle) {
01078 #ifndef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01079             status = bm_flush_cache(equipment[index].buffer_handle, SYNC);
01080             if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01081                cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "bm_flush_cache(SYNC) error %d", status);
01082                return status;
01083             }
01084 #endif
01085          }
01086       } else {
01087          /* send unfragmented event */
01088 
01089          if (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) > (DWORD) max_event_size) {
01090             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "Event size %ld larger than maximum size %d",
01091                    (long) (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)), max_event_size);
01092             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01093          }
01094 
01095          /* send event to buffer */
01096          if (equipment[index].buffer_handle) {
01097 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01098             dm_pointer_increment(equipment[index].buffer_handle,
01099                                  pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01100 #else
01101             rpc_flush_event();
01102             status = bm_send_event(equipment[index].buffer_handle, pevent,
01103                                    pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01104             if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01105                cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "bm_send_event(SYNC) error %d", status);
01106                return status;
01107             }
01108             status = bm_flush_cache(equipment[index].buffer_handle, SYNC);
01109             if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01110                cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "bm_flush_cache(SYNC) error %d", status);
01111                return status;
01112             }
01113 #endif
01114          }
01115 
01116          /* send event to ODB if RO_ODB flag is set or history is on. Do not
01117             send SLOW events since the class driver does that */
01118          if ((eq_info->read_on & RO_ODB) ||
01119              (eq_info->history > 0 && (eq_info->eq_type & ~EQ_SLOW))) {
01120             update_odb(pevent, equipment[index].hkey_variables, equipment[index].format);
01121             equipment[index].odb_out++;
01122          }
01123       }
01124 
01125       equipment[index].bytes_sent += pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01126       equipment[index].events_sent++;
01127 
01128       equipment[index].stats.events_sent += equipment[index].events_sent;
01129       equipment[index].events_sent = 0;
01130    } else
01131       equipment[index].serial_number--;
01132 
01133    /* emtpy event buffer */
01134 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01135    if ((status = dm_area_flush()) != CM_SUCCESS)
01136       cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "dm_area_flush: %i", status);
01137 #endif
01138 
01139    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
01140       if (equipment[i].buffer_handle) {
01141          status = bm_flush_cache(equipment[i].buffer_handle, SYNC);
01142          if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01143             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_event", "bm_flush_cache(SYNC) error %d", status);
01144             return status;
01145          }
01146       }
01147 
01148    return CM_SUCCESS;
01149 }
01150 
01151 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01152 
01153 void send_all_periodic_events(INT transition)
01154 {
01155    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
01156    INT i;
01157 
01158    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
01159       eq_info = &equipment[i].info;
01160 
01161       if (!eq_info->enabled || equipment[i].status != FE_SUCCESS)
01162          continue;
01163 
01164       if (transition == TR_START && (eq_info->read_on & RO_BOR) == 0)
01165          continue;
01166       if (transition == TR_STOP && (eq_info->read_on & RO_EOR) == 0)
01167          continue;
01168       if (transition == TR_PAUSE && (eq_info->read_on & RO_PAUSE) == 0)
01169          continue;
01170       if (transition == TR_RESUME && (eq_info->read_on & RO_RESUME) == 0)
01171          continue;
01172 
01173       send_event(i);
01174    }
01175 }
01176 
01177 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01178 
01179 BOOL interrupt_enabled;
01180 
01181 void interrupt_enable(BOOL flag)
01182 {
01183    interrupt_enabled = flag;
01184 
01185    if (interrupt_eq) {
01186       if (interrupt_enabled)
01187          interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE, 0, 0);
01188       else
01189          interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE, 0, 0);
01190    }
01191 }
01192 
01193 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01194 
01195 void interrupt_routine(void)
01196 {
01197    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01198 
01199    /* get pointer for upcoming event.
01200       This is a blocking call if no space available */
01201    if ((pevent = dm_pointer_get()) == NULL)
01202       cm_msg(MERROR, "interrupt_routine", "interrupt, dm_pointer_get returned NULL");
01203 
01204    /* compose MIDAS event header */
01205    pevent->event_id = interrupt_eq->info.event_id;
01206    pevent->trigger_mask = interrupt_eq->info.trigger_mask;
01207    pevent->data_size = 0;
01208    pevent->time_stamp = actual_time;
01209    pevent->serial_number = interrupt_eq->serial_number++;
01210 
01211    /* call user readout routine */
01212    pevent->data_size = interrupt_eq->readout((char *) (pevent + 1), 0);
01213 
01214    /* send event */
01215    if (pevent->data_size) {
01216       interrupt_eq->bytes_sent += pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01217       interrupt_eq->events_sent++;
01218 
01219       if (interrupt_eq->buffer_handle) {
01220 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01221          dm_pointer_increment(interrupt_eq->buffer_handle,
01222                               pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01223 #else
01224          rpc_send_event(interrupt_eq->buffer_handle, pevent,
01225                         pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01226 #endif
01227       }
01228 
01229       /* send event to ODB */
01230       if (interrupt_eq->info.read_on & RO_ODB || interrupt_eq->info.history) {
01231          if (actual_millitime - interrupt_eq->last_called > ODB_UPDATE_TIME) {
01232             interrupt_eq->last_called = actual_millitime;
01233             memcpy(interrupt_odb_buffer, pevent,
01234                    pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01235             interrupt_odb_buffer_valid = TRUE;
01236             interrupt_eq->odb_out++;
01237          }
01238       }
01239    } else
01240       interrupt_eq->serial_number--;
01241 
01242 }
01243 
01244 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01245 
01246 int message_print(const char *msg)
01247 {
01248    char str[160];
01249 
01250    memset(str, ' ', 159);
01251    str[159] = 0;
01252 
01253    if (msg[0] == '[')
01254       msg = strchr(msg, ']') + 2;
01255 
01256    memcpy(str, msg, strlen(msg));
01257    ss_printf(0, 20, str);
01258 
01259    return 0;
01260 }
01261 
01262 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01263 
01264 void display(BOOL bInit)
01265 {
01266    INT i, status;
01267    time_t full_time;
01268    char str[30];
01269 
01270    if (bInit) {
01271       ss_clear_screen();
01272 
01273       if (host_name[0])
01274          strcpy(str, host_name);
01275       else
01276          strcpy(str, "<local>");
01277 
01278       ss_printf(0, 0, "%s connected to %s. Press \"!\" to exit", full_frontend_name, str);
01279       ss_printf(0, 1,
01280                 "================================================================================");
01281       ss_printf(0, 2, "Run status:   %s",
01282                 run_state == STATE_STOPPED ? "Stopped" : run_state ==
01283                 STATE_RUNNING ? "Running" : "Paused");
01284       ss_printf(25, 2, "Run number %d   ", run_number);
01285       ss_printf(0, 3,
01286                 "================================================================================");
01287       ss_printf(0, 4,
01288                 "Equipment     Status     Events     Events/sec Rate[kB/s] ODB->FE    FE->ODB");
01289       ss_printf(0, 5,
01290                 "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------");
01291       for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
01292          ss_printf(0, i + 6, "%s", equipment[i].name);
01293    }
01294 
01295    /* display time */
01296    time(&full_time);
01297    strcpy(str, ctime(&full_time) + 11);
01298    str[8] = 0;
01299    ss_printf(72, 0, "%s", str);
01300 
01301    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
01302       status = equipment[i].status;
01303 
01304       if ((status == 0 || status == FE_SUCCESS) && equipment[i].info.enabled)
01305          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "OK       ");
01306       else if (!equipment[i].info.enabled)
01307          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "Disabled ");
01308       else if (status == FE_ERR_ODB)
01309          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "ODB Error");
01310       else if (status == FE_ERR_HW)
01311          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "HW Error ");
01312       else if (status == FE_ERR_DISABLED)
01313          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "Disabled ");
01314       else
01315          ss_printf(14, i + 6, "Unknown  ");
01316 
01317       if (equipment[i].stats.events_sent > 1E9)
01318          ss_printf(25, i + 6, "%1.3lfG     ", equipment[i].stats.events_sent / 1E9);
01319       else if (equipment[i].stats.events_sent > 1E6)
01320          ss_printf(25, i + 6, "%1.3lfM     ", equipment[i].stats.events_sent / 1E6);
01321       else
01322          ss_printf(25, i + 6, "%1.0lf      ", equipment[i].stats.events_sent);
01323       ss_printf(36, i + 6, "%1.1lf      ", equipment[i].stats.events_per_sec);
01324       ss_printf(47, i + 6, "%1.1lf      ", equipment[i].stats.kbytes_per_sec);
01325       ss_printf(58, i + 6, "%ld       ", equipment[i].odb_in);
01326       ss_printf(69, i + 6, "%ld       ", equipment[i].odb_out);
01327    }
01328 
01329    /* go to next line */
01330    ss_printf(0, i + 6, "");
01331 }
01332 
01333 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01334 
01335 BOOL logger_root()
01336 /* check if logger uses ROOT format */
01337 {
01338    int size, i, status;
01339    char str[80];
01340    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKey;
01341 
01342    if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Channels", &hKeyRoot) == DB_SUCCESS) {
01343       for (i = 0;; i++) {
01344          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i, &hKey);
01345          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
01346             break;
01347 
01348          strcpy(str, "MIDAS");
01349          size = sizeof(str);
01350          db_get_value(hDB, hKey, "Settings/Format", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
01351 
01352          if (equal_ustring(str, "ROOT"))
01353             return TRUE;
01354       }
01355    }
01356 
01357    return FALSE;
01358 }
01359 
01360 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01361 
01362 INT scheduler(void)
01363 {
01364    EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
01365    EQUIPMENT *eq;
01366    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01367    DWORD last_time_network = 0, last_time_display = 0, last_time_flush = 0, readout_start;
01368    INT i, j, index, status, ch, source, size, state;
01369    char str[80];
01370    BOOL buffer_done, flag, force_update = FALSE;
01371 
01372    INT opt_max = 0, opt_index = 0, opt_tcp_size = 128, opt_cnt = 0;
01373    INT err;
01374 
01375 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01376    rpc_set_opt_tcp_size(1024);
01377 #ifdef PPCxxx
01378    rpc_set_opt_tcp_size(NET_TCP_SIZE);
01379 #endif
01380 #endif
01381 
01382    /*----------------- MAIN equipment loop ------------------------------*/
01383 
01384    do {
01385       actual_millitime = ss_millitime();
01386       actual_time = ss_time();
01387 
01388       /*---- loop over equipment table -------------------------------*/
01389       for (index = 0;; index++) {
01390          eq = &equipment[index];
01391          eq_info = &eq->info;
01392 
01393          /* check if end of equipment list */
01394          if (!eq->name[0])
01395             break;
01396 
01397          if (!eq_info->enabled)
01398             continue;
01399 
01400          if (eq->status != FE_SUCCESS)
01401             continue;
01402 
01403          /*---- call idle routine for slow control equipment ----*/
01404          if ((eq_info->eq_type & EQ_SLOW) && eq->status == FE_SUCCESS) {
01405             if (eq_info->event_limit > 0 && run_state == STATE_RUNNING) {
01406                if (actual_time - eq->last_idle >= (DWORD) eq_info->event_limit) {
01407                   eq->cd(CMD_IDLE, eq);
01408                   eq->last_idle = actual_time;
01409                }
01410             } else
01411                eq->cd(CMD_IDLE, eq);
01412          }
01413 
01414          if (run_state == STATE_STOPPED && (eq_info->read_on & RO_STOPPED) == 0)
01415             continue;
01416          if (run_state == STATE_PAUSED && (eq_info->read_on & RO_PAUSED) == 0)
01417             continue;
01418          if (run_state == STATE_RUNNING && (eq_info->read_on & RO_RUNNING) == 0)
01419             continue;
01420 
01421          /*---- check periodic events ----*/
01422          if ((eq_info->eq_type & EQ_PERIODIC) || (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_SLOW)) {
01423             if (eq_info->period == 0)
01424                continue;
01425 
01426             /* check if period over */
01427             if (actual_millitime - eq->last_called >= (DWORD) eq_info->period) {
01428                /* disable interrupts during readout */
01429                interrupt_enable(FALSE);
01430 
01431                /* readout and send event */
01432                status = send_event(index);
01433 
01434                if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
01435                   cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "send_event error %d", status);
01436                   goto net_error;
01437                }
01438 
01439                /* re-enable the interrupt after periodic */
01440                interrupt_enable(TRUE);
01441             }
01442          }
01443 
01444          /* end of periodic equipments */
01445          /*---- check polled events ----*/
01446          if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_POLLED) {
01447             readout_start = actual_millitime;
01448             pevent = NULL;
01449 
01450             while ((source = poll_event(eq_info->source, eq->poll_count, FALSE)) > 0) {
01451                pevent = dm_pointer_get();
01452                if (pevent == NULL) {
01453                   cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler",
01454                          "polled, dm_pointer_get not returning valid pointer");
01455                   status = SS_NO_MEMORY;
01456                   goto net_error;
01457                }
01458 
01459                /* compose MIDAS event header */
01460                pevent->event_id = eq_info->event_id;
01461                pevent->trigger_mask = eq_info->trigger_mask;
01462                pevent->data_size = 0;
01463                pevent->time_stamp = actual_time;
01464                pevent->serial_number = eq->serial_number;
01465 
01466                /* put source at beginning of event, will be overwritten by 
01467                   user readout code, just a special feature used by some 
01468                   multi-source applications */
01469                *(INT *) (pevent + 1) = source;
01470 
01471                if (eq->info.num_subevents) {
01472                   eq->subevent_number = 0;
01473                   do {
01474                      *(INT *) ((char *) (pevent + 1) + pevent->data_size) = source;
01475 
01476                      /* call user readout routine for subevent indicating offset */
01477                      size = eq->readout((char *) (pevent + 1), pevent->data_size);
01478                      pevent->data_size += size;
01479                      if (size > 0) {
01480                         if (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) >
01481                             (DWORD) max_event_size) {
01482                            cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler",
01483                                   "Event size %ld larger than maximum size %d",
01484                                   (long) (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)),
01485                                   max_event_size);
01486                         }
01487 
01488                         eq->subevent_number++;
01489                         eq->serial_number++;
01490                      }
01491 
01492                      /* wait for next event */
01493                      do {
01494                         source = poll_event(eq_info->source, eq->poll_count, FALSE);
01495 
01496                         if (source == FALSE) {
01497                            actual_millitime = ss_millitime();
01498 
01499                            /* repeat no more than period */
01500                            if (actual_millitime - readout_start > (DWORD) eq_info->period)
01501                               break;
01502                         }
01503                      } while (source == FALSE);
01504 
01505                   } while (eq->subevent_number < eq->info.num_subevents && source);
01506 
01507                   /* notify readout routine about end of super-event */
01508                   pevent->data_size = eq->readout((char *) (pevent + 1), -1);
01509                } else {
01510                   /* call user readout routine indicating event source */
01511                   pevent->data_size = eq->readout((char *) (pevent + 1), 0);
01512 
01513                   /* check event size */
01514                   if (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) > (DWORD) max_event_size) {
01515                      cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler",
01516                             "Event size %ld larger than maximum size %d",
01517                             (long) (pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)),
01518                             max_event_size);
01519                   }
01520 
01521                   /* increment serial number if event read out sucessfully */
01522                   if (pevent->data_size)
01523                      eq->serial_number++;
01524                }
01525 
01526                /* send event */
01527                if (pevent->data_size) {
01528                   if (eq->buffer_handle) {
01529                      /* send first event to ODB if logger writes in root format */
01530                      if (pevent->serial_number == 1)
01531                         if (logger_root())
01532                            update_odb(pevent, eq->hkey_variables, eq->format);
01533 
01534 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01535                      dm_pointer_increment(eq->buffer_handle,
01536                                           pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01537 #else
01538                      status = rpc_send_event(eq->buffer_handle, pevent,
01539                                              pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER),
01540                                              SYNC);
01541 
01542                      if (status != SUCCESS) {
01543                         cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "rpc_send_event error %d", status);
01544                         goto net_error;
01545                      }
01546 #endif
01547 
01548                      eq->bytes_sent += pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01549 
01550                      if (eq->info.num_subevents)
01551                         eq->events_sent += eq->subevent_number;
01552                      else
01553                         eq->events_sent++;
01554                   }
01555                }
01556 
01557                actual_millitime = ss_millitime();
01558 
01559                /* repeat no more than period */
01560                if (actual_millitime - readout_start > (DWORD) eq_info->period)
01561                   break;
01562 
01563                /* quit if event limit is reached */
01564                if (eq_info->event_limit > 0 &&
01565                    eq->stats.events_sent + eq->events_sent >= eq_info->event_limit)
01566                   break;
01567             }
01568 
01569             /* send event to ODB */
01570             if (pevent && (eq_info->read_on & RO_ODB || eq_info->history)) {
01571                if (actual_millitime - eq->last_called > ODB_UPDATE_TIME && pevent != NULL) {
01572                   eq->last_called = actual_millitime;
01573                   update_odb(pevent, eq->hkey_variables, eq->format);
01574                   eq->odb_out++;
01575                }
01576             }
01577          }
01578 
01579          /*---- send interrupt events ----*/
01580          if (eq_info->eq_type & EQ_INTERRUPT) {
01581             /* not much to do as work being done independently in interrupt_routine() */
01582 
01583             /* update ODB */
01584             if (interrupt_odb_buffer_valid) {
01585                update_odb(interrupt_odb_buffer, interrupt_eq->hkey_variables,
01586                           interrupt_eq->format);
01587                interrupt_odb_buffer_valid = FALSE;
01588             }
01589 
01590          }
01591 
01592          /*---- check if event limit is reached ----*/
01593          if (eq_info->eq_type != EQ_SLOW &&
01594              eq_info->event_limit > 0 &&
01595              eq->stats.events_sent + eq->events_sent >= eq_info->event_limit &&
01596              run_state == STATE_RUNNING) {
01597             /* stop run */
01598             if (cm_transition(TR_STOP, 0, str, sizeof(str), SYNC, FALSE) != CM_SUCCESS)
01599                cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "cannot stop run: %s", str);
01600 
01601             /* check if autorestart, main loop will take care of it */
01602             size = sizeof(BOOL);
01603             flag = FALSE;
01604             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Auto restart", &flag, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
01605 
01606             if (flag)
01607                auto_restart = ss_time() + 20;   /* restart in 20 sec. */
01608 
01609             /* update event display correctly */
01610             force_update = TRUE;
01611          }
01612       }
01613 
01614       /*---- call frontend_loop periodically -------------------------*/
01615       if (frontend_call_loop) {
01616          status = frontend_loop();
01617          if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01618             status = RPC_SHUTDOWN;
01619       }
01620 
01621       /*---- check for deferred transitions --------------------------*/
01622       cm_check_deferred_transition();
01623 
01624       /*---- check for manual triggered events -----------------------*/
01625       if (manual_trigger_event_id) {
01626          interrupt_enable(FALSE);
01627 
01628          /* readout and send event */
01629          status = BM_INVALID_PARAM; 
01630          for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
01631             if (equipment[i].info.event_id == manual_trigger_event_id) {
01632                status = send_event(i);
01633                break;
01634             }
01635 
01636          manual_trigger_event_id = 0;
01637 
01638          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
01639             cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "send_event error %d", status);
01640             goto net_error;
01641          }
01642 
01643          /* re-enable the interrupt after periodic */
01644          interrupt_enable(TRUE);
01645       }
01646 
01647       /*---- calculate rates and update status page periodically -----*/
01648       if (force_update ||
01649           (display_period
01650            && actual_millitime - last_time_display > (DWORD) display_period)
01651           || (!display_period && actual_millitime - last_time_display > 3000)) {
01652          force_update = FALSE;
01653 
01654          /* calculate rates */
01655          if (actual_millitime != last_time_display) {
01656             max_bytes_per_sec = 0;
01657             for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
01658                eq = &equipment[i];
01659                eq->stats.events_sent += eq->events_sent;
01660                eq->stats.events_per_sec =
01661                    eq->events_sent / ((actual_millitime - last_time_display) / 1000.0);
01662                eq->stats.kbytes_per_sec =
01663                    eq->bytes_sent / 1024.0 / ((actual_millitime - last_time_display) /
01664                                               1000.0);
01665 
01666                if ((INT) eq->bytes_sent > max_bytes_per_sec)
01667                   max_bytes_per_sec = eq->bytes_sent;
01668 
01669                eq->bytes_sent = 0;
01670                eq->events_sent = 0;
01671             }
01672 
01673             max_bytes_per_sec = (DWORD)
01674                 ((double) max_bytes_per_sec /
01675                  ((actual_millitime - last_time_display) / 1000.0));
01676 
01677             /* tcp buffer size evaluation */
01678             if (optimize) {
01679                opt_max = MAX(opt_max, (INT) max_bytes_per_sec);
01680                ss_printf(0, opt_index, "%6d : %5.1lf %5.1lf", opt_tcp_size,
01681                          opt_max / 1024.0, max_bytes_per_sec / 1024.0);
01682                if (++opt_cnt == 10) {
01683                   opt_cnt = 0;
01684                   opt_max = 0;
01685                   opt_index++;
01686                   opt_tcp_size = 1 << (opt_index + 7);
01687                   rpc_set_opt_tcp_size(opt_tcp_size);
01688                   if (1 << (opt_index + 7) > 0x8000) {
01689                      opt_index = 0;
01690                      opt_tcp_size = 1 << 7;
01691                      rpc_set_opt_tcp_size(opt_tcp_size);
01692                   }
01693                }
01694             }
01695 
01696          }
01697 
01698          /* propagate changes in equipment to ODB */
01699          rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
01700          db_send_changed_records();
01701          rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
01702 
01703          if (display_period) {
01704             display(FALSE);
01705 
01706             /* check keyboard */
01707             ch = 0;
01708             status = 0;
01709             while (ss_kbhit()) {
01710                ch = ss_getchar(0);
01711                if (ch == -1)
01712                   ch = getchar();
01713 
01714                if (ch == '!')
01715                   status = RPC_SHUTDOWN;
01716             }
01717 
01718             if (ch > 0)
01719                display(TRUE);
01720             if (status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
01721                break;
01722          }
01723 
01724          last_time_display = actual_millitime;
01725       }
01726 
01727       /*---- check to flush cache ------------------------------------*/
01728       if (actual_millitime - last_time_flush > 1000) {
01729          last_time_flush = actual_millitime;
01730 
01731          /* if cache on server is not filled in one second at current
01732             data rate, flush it now to make events available to consumers */
01733 
01734          if (max_bytes_per_sec < SERVER_CACHE_SIZE) {
01735             interrupt_enable(FALSE);
01736 
01737 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01738             if ((status = dm_area_flush()) != CM_SUCCESS)
01739                cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "dm_area_flush: %i", status);
01740 #endif
01741 
01742             for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
01743                if (equipment[i].buffer_handle) {
01744                   /* check if buffer already flushed */
01745                   buffer_done = FALSE;
01746                   for (j = 0; j < i; j++)
01747                      if (equipment[i].buffer_handle == equipment[j].buffer_handle) {
01748                         buffer_done = TRUE;
01749                         break;
01750                      }
01751 
01752                   if (!buffer_done) {
01753                      rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
01754                      rpc_flush_event();
01755                      err = bm_flush_cache(equipment[i].buffer_handle, ASYNC);
01756                      if (err != BM_SUCCESS) {
01757                         cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "bm_flush_cache(ASYNC) error %d",
01758                                err);
01759                         return err;
01760                      }
01761                      rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
01762                   }
01763                }
01764             }
01765             interrupt_enable(TRUE);
01766          }
01767       }
01768 
01769       /*---- check for auto restart --------------------------------*/
01770       if (auto_restart > 0 && ss_time() > auto_restart) {
01771          /* check if really stopped */
01772          size = sizeof(state);
01773          status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
01774          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01775             cm_msg(MERROR, "scheduler", "cannot get Runinfo/State in database");
01776 
01777          if (state == STATE_STOPPED) {
01778             auto_restart = 0;
01779             size = sizeof(run_number);
01780             status =
01781                 db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT,
01782                              TRUE);
01783             assert(status == SUCCESS);
01784 
01785             if (run_number <= 0) {
01786                cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "aborting on attempt to use invalid run number %d",
01787                       run_number);
01788                abort();
01789             }
01790 
01791             cm_msg(MTALK, "main", "starting new run");
01792             status = cm_transition(TR_START, run_number + 1, NULL, 0, SYNC, FALSE);
01793             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
01794                cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "cannot restart run");
01795          }
01796       }
01797 
01798       /*---- check network messages ----------------------------------*/
01799       if (run_state == STATE_RUNNING && interrupt_eq == NULL) {
01800          /* only call yield once every 100ms when running */
01801          if (actual_millitime - last_time_network > 100) {
01802             status = cm_yield(0);
01803             last_time_network = actual_millitime;
01804          } else
01805             status = RPC_SUCCESS;
01806       } else
01807          /* when run is stopped or interrupts used, 
01808             call yield with 100ms timeout */
01809          status = cm_yield(100);
01810 
01811       /* exit for VxWorks */
01812       if (fe_stop)
01813          status = RPC_SHUTDOWN;
01814 
01815    } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
01816 
01817  net_error:
01818 
01819    return status;
01820 }
01821 
01822 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01823 
01824 #ifdef HAVE_CAMAC
01825 
01826 INT cnaf_callback(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
01827 {
01828    DWORD cmd, b, c, n, a, f, *pdword, *size, *x, *q, dtemp;
01829    WORD *pword, *pdata, temp;
01830    INT i, count;
01831 
01832    /* Decode parameters */
01833    cmd = CDWORD(0);
01834    b = CDWORD(1);
01835    c = CDWORD(2);
01836    n = CDWORD(3);
01837    a = CDWORD(4);
01838    f = CDWORD(5);
01839    pdword = CPDWORD(6);
01840    pword = CPWORD(6);
01841    pdata = CPWORD(6);
01842    size = CPDWORD(7);
01843    x = CPDWORD(8);
01844    q = CPDWORD(9);
01845 
01846    /* determine repeat count */
01847    if (index == RPC_CNAF16)
01848       count = *size / sizeof(WORD);     /* 16 bit */
01849    else
01850       count = *size / sizeof(DWORD);    /* 24 bit */
01851 
01852    switch (cmd) {
01853     /*---- special commands ----*/
01854 
01855    case CNAF_INHIBIT_SET:
01856       cam_inhibit_set(c);
01857       break;
01858    case CNAF_INHIBIT_CLEAR:
01859       cam_inhibit_clear(c);
01860       break;
01861    case CNAF_CRATE_CLEAR:
01862       cam_crate_clear(c);
01863       break;
01864    case CNAF_CRATE_ZINIT:
01865       cam_crate_zinit(c);
01866       break;
01867 
01868    case CNAF_TEST:
01869       break;
01870 
01871    case CNAF:
01872       if (index == RPC_CNAF16) {
01873          for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
01874             if (f < 16)
01875                cam16i_q(c, n, a, f, pword++, (int *) x, (int *) q);
01876             else if (f < 24)
01877                cam16o_q(c, n, a, f, pword[i], (int *) x, (int *) q);
01878             else
01879                cam16i_q(c, n, a, f, &temp, (int *) x, (int *) q);
01880       } else {
01881          for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
01882             if (f < 16)
01883                cam24i_q(c, n, a, f, pdword++, (int *) x, (int *) q);
01884             else if (f < 24)
01885                cam24o_q(c, n, a, f, pdword[i], (int *) x, (int *) q);
01886             else
01887                cam24i_q(c, n, a, f, &dtemp, (int *) x, (int *) q);
01888       }
01889 
01890       break;
01891 
01892    case CNAF_nQ:
01893       if (index == RPC_CNAF16) {
01894          if (f < 16)
01895             cam16i_rq(c, n, a, f, (WORD **) & pdword, count);
01896       } else {
01897          if (f < 16)
01898             cam24i_rq(c, n, a, f, &pdword, count);
01899       }
01900 
01901       /* return reduced return size */
01902       *size = (int) pdword - (int) pdata;
01903       break;
01904 
01905    default:
01906       printf("cnaf: Unknown command 0x%X\n", (unsigned int) cmd);
01907    }
01908 
01909    if (debug) {
01910       if (index == RPC_CNAF16)
01911          printf("cmd=%d r=%d c=%d n=%d a=%d f=%d d=%X x=%d q=%d\n",
01912                 (int) cmd, (int) count, (int) c, (int) n, (int) a, (int) f,
01913                 (int) pword[0], (int) *x, (int) *q);
01914       else if (index == RPC_CNAF24)
01915          printf("cmd=%d r=%d c=%d n=%d a=%d f=%d d=%X x=%d q=%d\n",
01916                 (int) cmd, (int) count, (int) c, (int) n, (int) a, (int) f,
01917                 (int) pdword[0], (int) *x, (int) *q);
01918    }
01919 
01920    return RPC_SUCCESS;
01921 }
01922 
01923 #endif                          /* HAVE_CAMAC */
01924 
01925 
01926 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01927 
01928 INT get_frontend_index()
01929 {
01930    return frontend_index;
01931 }
01932 
01933 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01934 
01935 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01936 int mfe(char *ahost_name, char *aexp_name, BOOL adebug)
01937 #else
01938 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
01939 #endif
01940 {
01941    INT status, i, dm_size;
01942    INT daemon;
01943 
01944    host_name[0] = 0;
01945    exp_name[0] = 0;
01946    debug = FALSE;
01947    daemon = 0;
01948 
01949    setbuf(stdout, 0);
01950    setbuf(stderr, 0);
01951 
01952 #ifdef SIGPIPE
01953    signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
01954 #endif
01955 
01956 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01957    if (ahost_name)
01958       strcpy(host_name, ahost_name);
01959    if (aexp_name)
01960       strcpy(exp_name, aexp_name);
01961    debug = adebug;
01962 #else
01963 
01964    /* get default from environment */
01965    cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), exp_name, sizeof(exp_name));
01966 
01967    /* parse command line parameters */
01968    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
01969       if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
01970          debug = TRUE;
01971       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'D')
01972          daemon = 1;
01973       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'O')
01974          daemon = 2;
01975       else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
01976          if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
01977             goto usage;
01978          if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
01979             strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
01980          else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
01981             strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
01982          else if (argv[i][1] == 'i')
01983             frontend_index = atoi(argv[++i]);
01984          else {
01985           usage:
01986             printf("usage: frontend [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment] [-d] [-D] [-O] [-i n]\n");
01987             printf("         [-d]     Used to debug the frontend\n");
01988             printf("         [-D]     Become a daemon\n");
01989             printf("         [-O]     Become a daemon but keep stdout\n");
01990             printf("         [-i n]   Set frontend index (used for event building)\n");
01991             return 0;
01992          }
01993       }
01994    }
01995 #endif
01996 
01997 #ifdef PART_OF_MUCAP
01998   frontend_early_init();
01999 #endif
02000 
02001    /* check event and buffer sizes */
02002    if (event_buffer_size < 2 * max_event_size) {
02003       printf("event_buffer_size too small for max. event size\n");
02004       ss_sleep(5000);
02005       return 1;
02006    }
02007 
02008    if (max_event_size > MAX_EVENT_SIZE) {
02009       printf("Requested max_event_size (%d) exceeds max. system event size (%d)",
02010              max_event_size, MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
02011       ss_sleep(5000);
02012       return 1;
02013    }
02014 
02015    dm_size = event_buffer_size;
02016 
02017 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02018    /* override dm_size in case of VxWorks
02019       take remaining free memory and use 20% of it for dm_ */
02020    dm_size = 2 * 10 * (max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(INT));
02021    if (dm_size > memFindMax()) {
02022       cm_msg(MERROR, "mainFE", "Not enough mem space for event size");
02023       return 0;
02024    }
02025    /* takes overall 20% of the available memory resource for dm_() */
02026    dm_size = 0.2 * memFindMax();
02027 
02028    /* there are two buffers */
02029    dm_size /= 2;
02030 #endif
02031 
02032    /* reduce memory size for MS-DOS */
02033 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02034    if (dm_size > 0x4000)
02035       dm_size = 0x4000;         /* 16k */
02036 #endif
02037 
02038    /* add frontend index to frontend name if present */
02039    strcpy(full_frontend_name, frontend_name);
02040    if (frontend_index >= 0)
02041       sprintf(full_frontend_name+strlen(full_frontend_name), "%02d", frontend_index);
02042 
02043    /* inform user of settings */
02044    printf("Frontend name          :     %s\n", full_frontend_name);
02045    printf("Event buffer size      :     %d\n", event_buffer_size);
02046    printf("Buffer allocation      : 2 x %d\n", dm_size);
02047    printf("System max event size  :     %d\n", MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
02048    printf("User max event size    :     %d\n", max_event_size);
02049    if (max_event_size_frag > 0)
02050       printf("User max frag. size    :     %d\n", max_event_size_frag);
02051    printf("# of events per buffer :     %d\n\n", dm_size / max_event_size);
02052 
02053    if (daemon) {
02054       printf("\nBecoming a daemon...\n");
02055       ss_daemon_init(daemon == 2);
02056    }
02057 
02058    /* now connect to server */
02059    if (display_period) {
02060       if (host_name[0])
02061          printf("Connect to experiment %s on host %s...", exp_name, host_name);
02062       else
02063          printf("Connect to experiment %s...", exp_name);
02064    }
02065 
02066    status = cm_connect_experiment1(host_name, exp_name, full_frontend_name,
02067                                    NULL, DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE, DEFAULT_FE_TIMEOUT);
02068    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02069       /* let user read message before window might close */
02070       ss_sleep(5000);
02071       return 1;
02072    }
02073 
02074    if (display_period)
02075       printf("OK\n");
02076 
02077    /* book buffer space */
02078    status = dm_buffer_create(dm_size, max_event_size);
02079    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02080       printf("dm_buffer_create: Not enough memory or event too big\n");
02081       return 1;
02082    }
02083 
02084    /* remomve any dead frontend */
02085    cm_cleanup(full_frontend_name, FALSE);
02086 
02087    /* shutdown previous frontend */
02088    status = cm_shutdown(full_frontend_name, FALSE);
02089    if (status == CM_SUCCESS && display_period) {
02090       printf("Previous frontend stopped\n");
02091 
02092       /* let user read message */
02093       ss_sleep(3000);
02094    }
02095 
02096    /* register transition callbacks */
02097    if (cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_prestart, 400+crate_number) != CM_SUCCESS ||
02098        cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_start, 500+crate_number) != CM_SUCCESS ||
02099        cm_register_transition(TR_STOP, tr_stop, 500+crate_number) != CM_SUCCESS ||
02100        cm_register_transition(TR_PAUSE, tr_pause, 500+crate_number) != CM_SUCCESS ||
02101        cm_register_transition(TR_RESUME, tr_resume, 500+crate_number) != CM_SUCCESS) {
02102       printf("Failed to start local RPC server");
02103       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02104       dm_buffer_release();
02105 
02106       /* let user read message before window might close */
02107       ss_sleep(5000);
02108       return 1;
02109    }
02110 #ifdef HAVE_CAMAC
02111 
02112    /* register CNAF callback */
02113    cm_register_function(RPC_CNAF16, cnaf_callback);
02114    cm_register_function(RPC_CNAF24, cnaf_callback);
02115 
02116 #endif
02117 
02118    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &status);
02119 
02120    /* set time from server */
02121 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02122    cm_synchronize(NULL);
02123 #endif
02124 
02125    /* turn off watchdog if in debug mode */
02126    if (debug)
02127       cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, 0);
02128 
02129    /* increase RPC timeout to 2min for logger with exabyte or blocked disk */
02130    rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTIMEOUT, 120000);
02131 
02132    /* set own message print function */
02133    if (display_period)
02134       cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, MT_ALL, message_print);
02135 
02136    /* call user init function */
02137    if (display_period)
02138       printf("Init hardware...");
02139    if (frontend_init() != SUCCESS) {
02140       if (display_period)
02141          printf("\n");
02142       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02143       dm_buffer_release();
02144 
02145       /* let user read message before window might close */
02146       ss_sleep(5000);
02147       return 1;
02148    }
02149 
02150    /* reqister equipment in ODB */
02151    if (register_equipment() != SUCCESS) {
02152       if (display_period)
02153          printf("\n");
02154       cm_disconnect_experiment();
02155       dm_buffer_release();
02156 
02157       /* let user read message before window might close */
02158       ss_sleep(5000);
02159       return 1;
02160    }
02161 
02162    if (display_period)
02163       printf("OK\n");
02164 
02165    /* initialize screen display */
02166    if (display_period) {
02167       ss_sleep(1000);
02168       display(TRUE);
02169    }
02170 
02171    /* switch on interrupts if running */
02172    if (interrupt_eq && run_state == STATE_RUNNING)
02173       interrupt_enable(TRUE);
02174 
02175    /* initialize ss_getchar */
02176    ss_getchar(0);
02177 
02178    /* call main scheduler loop */
02179    status = scheduler();
02180 
02181    /* reset terminal */
02182    ss_getchar(TRUE);
02183 
02184    /* switch off interrupts */
02185    if (interrupt_eq) {
02186       interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE, 0, 0);
02187       interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH, 0, 0);
02188       if (interrupt_odb_buffer)
02189          free(interrupt_odb_buffer);
02190    }
02191 
02192    /* detach interrupts */
02193    if (interrupt_eq != NULL)
02194       interrupt_configure(CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH, interrupt_eq->info.source, 0);
02195 
02196    /* call user exit function */
02197    frontend_exit();
02198 
02199    /* close slow control drivers */
02200    for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++)
02201       if ((equipment[i].info.eq_type & EQ_SLOW) && equipment[i].status == FE_SUCCESS)
02202          equipment[i].cd(CMD_EXIT, &equipment[i]);
02203 
02204    /* close network connection to server */
02205    cm_disconnect_experiment();
02206 
02207    if (display_period) {
02208       if (status == RPC_SHUTDOWN) {
02209          ss_clear_screen();
02210          ss_printf(0, 0, "Frontend shut down.");
02211          ss_printf(0, 1, "");
02212       }
02213    }
02214 
02215    if (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN)
02216       printf("Network connection aborted.\n");
02217 
02218    dm_buffer_release();
02219 
02220    return 0;
02221 }
